enWisdom: The bane of development and prosperity is the oppression of a tyrant
Tyranny is indeed an evil administrative policy
Power is lost through aggression [and oppression]
In amassing the usurped rights [of the people] there is cessation [and loss] of power
One whose judgments are oppressive, his power comes to an end
One whose aggression is prolonged, his rule [soon] comes to an end
One whose rule is oppressive, his regime collapses

Wisdom: مَنْ عَامَلَ رَعِيَّتَهُ بِالظُّلْمِ أَزَالَ اللَّهُ مُلْكَهُ وَعَجَّلَ بَوَارَهُ وَهُلْكَهُ [هَلَاكَهُ‏]
enWisdom: Whoever treats the people unjustly, Allah causes his reign to end and hastens his ruin and destruction
Injustice is the ruination of the populace
The destruction of the populace is in tyranny
One who embarks of injustice is met with ruin

Wisdom: لَيْسَ شَيْ‏ءٌ أَفْسَدَ لِلْأُمُورِ وَلَا أَبْلَغَ فِي هَلَاكِ الْجُمْهُورِ مِنَ الشَّرِّ
enWisdom: There is nothing more corrupting for affairs or more destructive to the community than evil
One whose kingship is tyrannical, his destruction becomes great

Wisdom: مَنْ جَارَ فِي سُلْطَانِهِ وَأَكْثَرَ عُدْوَانَهُ هَدَمَ اللَّهُ بُنْيَانَهُ وَهَدَّ أَرْكَانَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever is tyrannical in his reign and increases his aggression, Allah will demolish his foundation and tear down his pillars [of kingship]

Wisdom: مَنْ جَارَ فِي سُلْطَانِهِ عُدَّ مِنْ عَوَادِي زَمَانِهِ
enWisdom: NULL
NULL
The tyrant king frightens the innocent
How bad an injustice is the injustice to one who is submissive!

Wisdom: قُلُوبُ الرَّعِيَّةِ خَزَائِنُ رَاعِيهَا فَمَا أَوْدَعَهَا مِنْ عَدْلٍ أَوْ جَوْرٍ وَجَدَهُ
enWisdom: The hearts of the people are the treasuries of their leader, so whatever he deposits in them, be it justice or oppression, he will find it there
One who oppresses his people helps his enemies
The honourable one never oppresses [others]
